intro: Cnemidostachys linearifolia, commonly known as the slender spike grass, is a perennial grass native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It features slender, linear leaves that are typically 30–100 cm long, with a smooth, grass-like texture. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open woodlands and savannas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes in warm climates.
